getInputIngredients(uint256).notice: gets input ingredients for a recipe id

getOutputIngredients(uint256).notice: gets output ingredients for a recipe id

toggleRecipe(uint256,bool).notice: toggles a recipe on or off

userdoc.notice: Recipe is just a list of input and output tokens User who has all the required input tokens can 'craft' new items. Ingredients get burn and new items are minted

devdoc.author: rayquaza7
devdoc.details: implements a modified/minimal version of https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/v4.7.2/contracts/proxy/utils/UUPSUpgradeable.sol Removed inheritance in order to simplify storage layout

addRecipe((address[],uint256[],uint256[].details: assumes that the ids you are adding are valid based on the spec in BattlePass.sol reverts when: ids.length != qtys.length != battlePasses.length for both input and output tokens

craft(uint256).details: reverts when: user does not own the input items recipe is not active

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate that the this implementation remains valid after an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

NewRecipe(uint256).details: emitted when new recipe is created

IncorrectRecipeDetails().details: used when creating a new recipe with incorrect ingredients

RecipeNotActive().details: used when crafting with an inactive recipe

devdoc.title: Craft recipes, make new yummy items

documentation.text: @dev used when crafting with an inactive recipe
@dev used when creating a new recipe with incorrect ingredients
